title: For Trump, the Truth in Minneapolis Is What He Says It Is
summary: The Trump team has advanced one-sided narratives to justify each of the killings, even when bystander video shows something else entirely.

title: Alex Jeffrey Pretti Knew He Wanted to Help Others
summary: Shot and killed by immigration agents on a Minneapolis street, he wanted to be a ‘force of good in the world.’

title: Winter Storm Drives U.S. Flight Cancellations to Pandemic-Level Numbers
summary: Nearly 9,000 departures were canceled on Sunday, more than on any other day since the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Another East Coast Storm? Don’t Buy the Hype Just Yet.
summary: After a computer model began hinting that another storm could be on the way, meteorologists sought to tamp down speculation.

title: A Sunday Snowstorm Blankets New York
summary: The city got about nine inches of snow and at least one person died from exposure to the cold as Mayor Zohran Mamdani faced his first big test in nuts-and-bolts governing.

title: Xi’s Purge of China’s Military Brings Its Top General Down
summary: The ouster of Gen. Zhang Youxia, who was second only to Xi Jinping in the military hierarchy, marks “the total annihilation of the high command,” one analyst said.

title: Columbia Selects University of Wisconsin Chancellor as Its President
summary: Jennifer Mnookin has led the flagship campus of the state university system since 2022.

title: Fashion Is Exaggerating the Female Form Like Never Before. What Is Going On?
summary: Fashion has begun exaggerating, or distorting, the female form like never before. What exactly is going on?

title: How Iran Crushed a Citizen Uprising With Lethal Force
summary: Protests erupted amid a communications blackout. But as video and witness accounts trickle out, the brutality of the regime’s crackdown is becoming clear.

title: Amid Two-Week Internet Blackout, Some Iranians Are Getting Back Online
summary: Many in Iran are gaining brief and unexplained windows of online connectivity, offering a widening glimpse of the extent of the government crackdown.

title: In Venezuela, Families Search for Relatives Who Are Detained and Missing
summary: Even as dozens of political prisoners have been freed, at least 66 people taken by state authorities and never heard from again remain missing, relatives and rights groups say.

title: Frank Carone, a Brooklyn Power Broker, Is Under Federal Investigation
summary: Federal prosecutors and the F.B.I. are scrutinizing Mr. Carone, who served as chief of staff during Eric Adams’s first year as mayor of New York.

title: Hard Times in the Mississippi Delta as Farmers Consider Letting Crops Rot
summary: Prices for nearly every major U.S. crop are below what it costs to grow them. But a drop in rice prices means another blow to farmers in Mississippi’s agricultural belt.

title: Travel Math: When Flying Costs as Much as the Train, Who Wins?
summary: Amtrak says dynamic pricing has helped strengthen its finances, but travelers often grumble at the cost, especially for last-minute travel. Still, the train has a secret weapon: avoiding the airport.

title: The Trump Administration Is Lying to Our Faces. Congress Must Act.
summary: The Trump administration is once again engaged in a perversion of justice.

title: Minneapolis and Gaza Now Share the Same Violent Language
summary: When ICE and Hamas start looking the same, we are all in trouble.

title: Pro-Israel Group Targets a Former Ally in an Early Congressional Race
summary: A super PAC affiliated with the American Israel Public Affairs Committee is running ads against Tom Malinowski, who is hoping to replace Gov. Mikie Sherrill of New Jersey in the House.

title: Eleanor Holmes Norton Files to End Re-election Campaign
summary: It was not clear whether Washington’s 88-year-old veteran delegate, who has been in declining health but has insisted she would seek re-election, was aware of the filing.

title: George Cabot Lodge, Last of His Family to Battle a Kennedy, Dies at 98
summary: The two Massachusetts clans faced off in elections for decades, until a final 1962 Senate race. Despite his loss, Mr. Lodge praised his opponent, Ted Kennedy.

title: In Visits to Dealerships, Pair Schemed to Steal High-End Vehicles, Police Say
summary: An organized theft ring in Connecticut, New Jersey and New York swapped or quickly cloned key fobs to steal millions of dollars’ worth of vehicles, officials said.
